text:
Here's how to use direct
messages on Instagram,
such as sending a DM,
using quick replies,
and creating group chats.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
parts of this tutorial.
Launch the Instagram app
and search the person you want to message
using the search icon here.

Go to their profile and
tap the message icon.
Direct messages will now open up.
Type your message here
and press "Send."

This message will now be
privately sent to the account.

Go to your messages by
tapping the icon here.
Tap the compose a new message icon.
Add the names of multiple accounts
you want to include in the group chat.
Compose your message and click "Send"
to open the chat with your message.
You can also start a group video chat
by tapping the video chat icon here.
In the direct messages page,
tapping the camera icon here
will give you access to your camera,
enabling you to take a picture
and send it as a photo message.
Tap and hold the microphone icon here
to send a voice message.
This will send immediately
without you having to press send.
The picture icon here
will allow you to send a picture
from your photo library.

The sticker icon here
allows you to send stickers.

Click the camera icon here
to start a video chat.

Change your DM settings
using the icon here,

which will enable you to
change the theme of the window
and mute messages.
Make sure you're on the home screen
by tapping the home icon here.

Your messages icon is
in the top right, here.

This will either look
like a paper airplane icon
or a messenger icon,

depending on which version
of Instagram you have.

Click this icon, and you'll
find all your messages.
In the "Primary" tab,
you'll see messages from people you know.
The "General" tab will show you
all the messages you've received.
"Message Requests" will show you messages
which will be kept on hold

until you accept or decline
the message request.
You can compose a new message
by tapping the icon here.
Search for or select the name
of the person you'd like to message

and tap "Chat" to open
the direct messages page.
